intro: Primula villosa subsp. villosa, commonly known as the hairy primrose, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features upright, hairy stems that bear several whorled leaves with a rough, hairy texture. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped, fragrant flowers in shades of yellow to orange, typically blooming in early spring. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in meadows and rocky slopes. Its hairy foliage and showy flowers make it a distinctive and ornamental species in its native habitat.
